title: Torque and work - work and RKE - tau-theta graph

content.question: An object can rotate about an axis passing through its center of mass. At <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the object is spinning in the positive direction and has an initial angular position of zero. The graph represents the net torque <math alttext="tau sub net" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>net</mtext></msub></math> exerted on the object as a function of angular position <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math>. Which of the following claims is true about the total work done on the object and the rotational kinetic energy of the object as it rotates from <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn></math> radians to <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> radians?

choices.label: The total work is zero. The rotational kinetic energy is a maximum when <math alttext="theta equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

The total work is zero. The rotational kinetic energy is a maximum when <math alttext="theta equals 1 radian" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>radian</mi></math>.
The total work is negative. The rotational kinetic energy is a maximum when <math alttext="theta equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

The total work is negative. The rotational kinetic energy is a maximum when <math alttext="theta equals 1 radian" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>radian</mi></math>.

content.answer: The total work is zero. The rotational kinetic energy is a maximum when <math alttext="theta equals 1 radian" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>radian</mi></math>.
